snippet: New accounting rules will force better disclosure of assets and liabilities of American banks that trade heavily in derivatives.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column notes that loose American accounting rules allow large banks that trade in derivatives to keep trillions of dollars in assets and liabilities off balance sheets, making it difficult to evaluate their size or compare them; holds such comparisons will be marginally easier when European and American banks start using similar disclosures in first quarter of 2013.
lead_paragraph: New accounting rules will force better disclosure of assets and liabilities of American banks that trade heavily in derivatives.

headline.print_headline: Hidden Numbers Make Banks Even Bigger
headline.seo: New Rules Will Give a Truer Picture of Banks’ Size
